title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 May 2009 - XWiki

marta\_ joined #xwiki at 08:05  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:05): hi tharindu\_  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:06): hi  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:07): marta\_: hi I just saw the message now  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:10): about the gsoc blog problem  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:11): yes do you know why it happened  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:11): now I do not see edit menu  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:12): i couldn't reproduce it, it worked fine for me... so i don't know what prevented you from publishing the article. i'll have to do more tests when i have the time to see what causes the bug  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:12): i published the blog post for you and gave you back the edit rights  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:12): Thanks :)  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:13): you shouldn't give admins edit rights, they already have them  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:13): anyway, please take a look to see if everything's back to normal  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:14): no just because I could not publish it I did those changes  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:14): just to check whether it will fix  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:14): i understand  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 08:14  
tharindu\_ - (29/05/2009 08:15): :)  
marta\_ - (29/05/2009 08:18): i've got to go now. bye  
marta\_ left #xwiki at 08:18  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:37  
rrodriguez\_ left at 08:37 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 08:37  
rrodriguez left at 08:39 (Client Quit)  
trifon joined #xwiki at 08:41  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:45): vmassol : Hi  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:45): arunreddy\_\_: hi  
asyd - (29/05/2009 08:46): hello there  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:46): Am testing the existing framework of parsers.  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:46): WikiModelMediawiki   
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:47): it doesnt support Links and Tables  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:47): arunreddy\_\_: yes  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:47): and also XWiki parser doesnt parse XWiki 2.0 syntax links   
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:47): re links you/we need to implement a LinkParser for it if we want to support it  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:47): (which we do)  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:48): there is a existing XWikiLinkParser with limited functionalitly.  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:48): arunreddy\_\_: yes that's because wikimodel only parse the label and the refernce but not inside ther efence  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:48): and support for XWiki 1.0 syntax  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:48): no no  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:48): so in XDOMGeneratorListener we parse the link reference to generate a Link object  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:49): each parser has its own LinkParser injected  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:49): for now we have 2 parsers implemented: a XWiki Link parser and a generic one (based on the xwiki one)  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:49): in practice we need to write the link parser for each syntax we want to support  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:49): yes even am planning to do that.  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:50): you just need to implement LinkParser  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:50): btw can you give me a mediawiki link example?  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:50): 1 min  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:51): right now the generic parser will parse format like: (wiki:)(space.)(pagename) where wiki and space are optional (without the parenthesis)  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:51): so I guess it should work for simple links even in mediawiki  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): a way similar to XWiki  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): [[name of page]]  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): [[name of page|display text]]  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:52): so reference is "'name of page" and should work fine with the generic xparser  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): External   
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): [http://www.example.com]  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:52): [http://www.example.com display text]  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:52): yep tthat should work too  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:53): Internal is XWiki 2.0 way  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:53): and external links are XWiki 1.0 way  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:54): arunreddy\_\_: maybe it's a wikimodel parse issue too  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:55): you'll need to debug this  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 08:55): bbiab  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 08:55): bbiab ?  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 09:02): vmassol : http://viewer.zoho.com/docs/qfate  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 09:03): I tried to make use of the existing framework here, to parse MediaWiki syntax and render the same into XWiki 2.0 Syntax  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 09:04  
kaaloo left at 09:09 ("Leaving.")  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:12): arunreddy\_\_: btw this is not the right way to use the rendering  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:12): you must use a component manager to get the parser  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:12): that's why it doesn't work   
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:13): same for the XHTMLRenderer  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:13): you're using the simple XHTML link/image renderers instead of the xwiki ones  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:13): basically you're not allowed to do any new  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:13): (except for DefaultWikiPrinter which is not  a component)  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 09:14): have a look at the documentation of the rendering module  
arunreddy\_\_ - (29/05/2009 09:14): Ok  
vmassol left at 09:34 ()

lucien - (29/05/2009 11:23): Hi all,  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:23): I'm wondering if current component manager refactoring is introducing some limitations concerning depedency injection. Indeed from some classes I can't retrieve component reference (I have got a NullPointerException).  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:23): Do you got any information about that ?  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 11:26  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:29  
cristinas joined #xwiki at 11:30  
rrodriguez\_ left at 11:32 ()  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 11:38): lucien: hi  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:38): vincent: hi  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 11:39): re your problem you need to give more details, all should work fine  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:41): I don't understand what happend, from some classes injection works well, but from other reference is null.  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:47): Is it possible to use depedency injection from a non component implementation class ?  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 11:56  
lucien - (29/05/2009 11:58): ok, I mistaken, forget it.  
tharindu\_\_ joined #xwiki at 12:16  
vmassol - (29/05/2009 12:22): lucien: ok :)

maggolo - (29/05/2009 14:49): hi @ all i use toucan skin and i wan't to know how i can change the gray collor form the top menu to black. I mean the menu overall pages with SpaceName: Siteneam > Sitename. Can someon tell me how to change this?  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 14:50  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 14:52): You should use firebug to see what rules are there  
tharindu\_\_ left at 15:02 ("Leaving")  
jk\_work joined #xwiki at 15:34  
kaaloo left at 15:37 ("Leaving.")  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:30): hi sdumitriu   
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:31): Hi anamarias  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31): I was trying to add Shindig 1.1-SNAPSHOT (which implements version 0.9 of Open Social API) as a dependency in my project, so I added to my pom :  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31):     <dependency>  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31): <groupId>org.apache.shindig</groupId>  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31): <artifactId>shindig-project</artifactId>  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31): <version>1.1-SNAPSHOT</version>  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31):     </dependency>  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:31): But, when trying to build my project it won't find this artifact as it's not present in the maven central repository, nor on xwiki's.  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:32): Where should I tell maven where shindig's repository is located ?  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:32): Then you must add the repository to the pom  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:32): with <repository> tags ?  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:32): Yes  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:33): Also, I wasn't able to actually find the actual maven repository, org.apache.shindig is not at any of these locations:  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:33): http://people.apache.org/repo/m2-snapshot-repository/  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:33): http://people.apache.org/repo/m2-incubating-repository/  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:33): https://repository.apache.org/index.html  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:33): I did find builds here : http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Shindig%20Assembly/lastBuild/, but I don't know how to use them for maven  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:36): If they're not in a public repo, we can add one to our server  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:38): so it is possible not to exist in any public repo...  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:38): You could ask them  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:38): ok, I will  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40): when maven fails to find the artifact, it recommends 2 options :  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40):   Then, install it using the command:   
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40):       mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=org.apache.shindig -DartifactId=shindig-project -Dversion=1.1-SNAPSHOT -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40):   Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there:   
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40):       mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=org.apache.shindig -DartifactId=shindig-project -Dversion=1.1-SNAPSHOT -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:40): i could try one of these in the meantime  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:41): Yes, you can put it locally  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:41): But it's better to have it in a repo  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:41): So that other people can build right out of the box  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:41): Q:  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:42): The artifact is a zip containing several jars  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:42): Do you need the zip, or the jars inside it?  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:43): actually the project has several submodules, and all have their own resulting jar  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:43): Yes  
alexmaru joined #xwiki at 16:43  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:43): That's the assembly result  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:43): so i guess will need those  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:43): So you should depend on each jar instead  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:44): something else  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:45): in the svn they have other files for testing  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:45): see here : http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/shindig/trunk/  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:45): besides the source code  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:46): I don't know what will happen to them after I include in my project only the built jars  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:46): I mean, how could I still use these tests and see if they work in my project  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:46): add them separately ?  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:47): the testing for the gadgets uses these files http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/shindig/trunk/javascript/samplecontainer/  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:49): Are those needed during the build?  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:49): AFAICS, they're supposed to be used manually  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:49): I don't think they are  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:51): i could add them to the project manually and see how it works then  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:52): how can I upload the snapshot to the repo ? do I need access rights ?  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:53): I'll do it  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:56): The jars should be here:   
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:57): http://people.apache.org/repo/m2-incubating-repository/org/apache/  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 16:57): But they aren't  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 16:57): yes, I though so  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 17:04  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 17:12): Done  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 17:12): The version is 1.1-SNAPSHOT-769  
sdumitriu - (29/05/2009 17:12): http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/org/apache/shindig/  
anamarias - (29/05/2009 17:13): thanks a lot !
